jDZdMApjnnwSYsjipr5JMQ.text: Good luck trying to find a bad meal or poor service at this INCREDIBLE diner.  And, for what it's worth, they serve up the BEST chicken and waffles I can remember ever having.  And, one of the servers, (Shanice) is extraordinary!  That's not to say the others are terrific, because they are.  But Shanice is outstanding!

lKYjbZYtV53Qw6j0YqZYSA.text: My husband and I love this place! Friendly service! Really good food, with a lot of variety! Even on a busy day, we usually get right in, without a long wait.

Q6Z-ewyWflVxw3pK4UIvpA.text: Excellent breakfast spot! We have been looking for a really good local restaurant. The hash browns were incredible, light golden brown on both sides & NOT greasy! Bacon cooked to perfection. The croissant French Toast was good. We will definitely be back. I'm anxious to try their pot roast for dinner.

L935nr4Zjt-pOTkscUUpmQ.text: Great place. Chicken and waffles is where it's at. Cone hungry or don't go at all. Great service

lNQPqbA917xaMrqFbyJ7mg.text: Arrived at the Metro at 5:40 on a Friday. Only one table occupied. Grandson had the Cinnamon Waffle and only ate half of it. This kid is 18 and could eat a side of beef. I had the meatloaf. Tasty but not hot. Gravy was tasteless. The mashed potatoes were cold and the vegetables were burnt.  Coffee was not hot either. Have always enjoyed the Metro but the lack of diners on a Friday should have sent up a red alert.Wont be back.

Zr8215Z-RLv5EJRPEhA7Dg.text: Edit from 5 to 1 star. Was great but just walked out after our server was extremely rude from the onset. Then we watched him standing at a table eating with his hands. Then wiping them on his pants, cleaning his mouth with his hands and going to the window to get food for guests. Disgusting!

B9B7VoQIvfztj2NJJ2_a_w.text: Best breakfast in a while.  Ham, eggs, hash browns, pancakes all cooked just as requested. Good service. Fair price.

KTfjLepjEdygMSke2Fw9aw.text: Each visit is better than the last. The chicken and waffles are a winner. The Crab Benedict Florentine was better than I expected. This will remain my go to Saturday brunch spot. $2 $2 $2 $2 $2

07TpCQ_xlMHq0a6ZfEyIAw.text: Great restaurant! Finally open in Charlotte.  Food is awesome, establishment is clean, service is great. The chicken and waffles is the best on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s great to go to a restaurant that truly acts and performs like they appreciate your business! Food and service is great!

SsLTxadB6_u5mMKsdikdug.text: Just had my first breakfast in Charlotte. Great food with huge portions. I had to take some food home for another meal. Friendly staff and food comes out quick.

L_3D57BAGrfYDCdka2NG-A.text: I have food sensitivities and I can eat here! Makes me very happy. Lovely staff. Good people.   Also, I invite clients to the diner for meetings over an hour long (I asked if it was cool first) and they literally accommodate you. It's my second office now.   And the prices!!! Who knew you could get a meal for two people under $20 in this town. :)

z2fq5rqS-4M21ZOh_vPrOw.text: Froze all the end times here.  Service was below average and once waited 45 minutes to order and get our food. Food is fine. We were eating dinner and maybe this is a place for breakfast.  Have them 3 tries and would had given them 1,3 and 3 stars.  We can find better places close by. They always seem busy so must be that they do a great job at other times but not a place for us.

qquACW9wHgYTHLZXEDuPCQ.text: My first time being here was amazing. There was a wait for good reason , but the coffee at the front made the wait easy.  I ordered the chicken and waffles... and let me tell you!!!! The waffles were great with their own strawberry buttery blend.   But that chicken!!!!! Simply amazing. Id rate 10 stars if i could.. super clean and great customer service. I'll most def me back soon

5EOR39CGlIT1U3EJ5wfSpA.text: Just finished my breakfast. Had the Boswell- everything was perfectly cooked and delicious. My son had the fruity French toast. Also delicious. The best thing about this place though is the people. Friendliest staff. We sat at the counter in front of the kitchen and we thoroughly enjoyed it.

2H9GQsrRRaQRL2xK-48WXw.text: At first I didn't know what to expect from this restaurant but as soon as I walked in everybody was super nice! I went with my mom and the waitress was super nice and kind. I really like this place bc it makes me think of the 50s but with a very modern look, which I love bc I wasn't alive by that time  but anyways they make you feel welcomed!

ouPE8M-8ibciM1h26Ul6BA.text: Really great diner in the Florida style of diners. Awesome servers.   Loses 2 stars due to a few items I feel the menu is missing. Namely, hot cocoa. That's pretty much a Florida diner staple. Otherwise, it was pretty good.   I recommend the waffle. Best I've had. Bar none.

EuqsN4Uz6X8iq0soGhk3uw.text: This place has great food, but the past 2 times I've eaten here, I've had an issue. The first time I found a gnat in my drink. The second time there was hair in my husbands steak. Both times I was generously compensated by the manager on duty, but it was still a huge inconvenience. Food is good, but sanitation could be better.

BCATvnjFqIHFwP4dwJSLMg.text: Great place.  Huge quantities of very good diner food.  Breakfast all day is awesome.  Friendly staff.

oMvrc5V82GYjBceE8_ptyg.text: Great breakfast and love the beverage bar concept....you can have coffee while you wait,  which makes waiting to be seated  not so bad.

fyTCTCMPU8a4xyzvRySuFA.text: First time visit and was amazed at the great food, good prices and super friendly staff! We had a chance to sit at the counter and watch this team up front and WOW! the people were actually happy to be there and were doing an amazing job at preparing the food in unison. No complaining, no hurry up, just a great team working together. The food was great and we will absolutely be back!

aZXEI8IrG3pJF3evTSm8yg.text: I have eaten here on several occasions with my family! They have the best food and great service. The waffles and fried chicken are the greatest dish, the breakfast is always on point. We live in Fort Mill but this is worth the trip! Food quality, customer service and a can do attitude makes this place top notch! We definitely will be back ! Keep up the great work!

XFHsh0WVgNas9861f0jKNg.text: If you want a grandma-made biscuit with real chunky gravy, this is the place! Also, don't forget to get their eggs over easy -it's Peeeeerrrfect!  The truth is I'm not southern. But my friends told me that this is the bomb and it is! So rare to find good sausage gravy.

hocT-1wtE85k2uW2mt1X4g.text: This was our 1st time here. It was wonderful. I had the New Orleans shrimp and grits and my hubby had an omelette along with an egg and sausage croissant sandwich. I also ordered a mimosa. The service was good. On thing I did like was that they use electric pads to take your order. Our food came out quick. Plus when you leave you can get yourself some free coffee, soft drink or sweet tea which was a great bounce. We will be back again real soon.

SAjm3A26y1w1CzDE3NXrUw.text: Really good food. I was expecting a stand alone "diner " yet it was within the business center with plenty other establishments.  They wait was about 15mins but I lucked up and got a couple spots at the bar. Our waitress was very welcoming and friendly and made great suggestions.  They proclaimed to have the best C&W in the city. Lol I've honestly have had better but the portions were large and the food was fresh, hot and well seasoned. The Charleston style shrimp and grits were really good as well. I would defiantly recommend this place and I'm sure I will go back again soon.

e7vs6EWXp9vb2UP-UQW0rw.text: We were traveling for work and my client recommended this place. Best recommendation ever!!!! The staff is friendly and efficient, the food is great tasting and a great value. I was absolutely floored at how awesome this place is; if you're super hungry, the Pulled Pork Mac Stack is the move! Kirin did a really great job with us while balancing a large party. Make sure you request his section!

1w_8SGISQgdPJVCeuATH-A.text: Best breakfast we have had in Charlotte. Great service, too! Nice atmosphere and friendly hosts. Best biscuits and gravy and huevos rancheros!

gZZvkw1cBiEOEzPeqh7vdA.text: Great customer service and great food! We were in Charlotte for a family reunion and stopped by for breakfast with a table of 8. From the sweet ladies at the hostess stand, to our wonderful waitress, Brittany, and even the nice lady bringing around coffee; Everyone was nice and engaging.   My 12 year old ordered the cinnamon roll pancakes. We didn't notice (the very large picture and description) that CLEARLY stated that the dish included pecans (she allergic). When they brought out the dish we saw the pecans and advised them of her allergy. They quickly removed the dish, apologize (although it was not her fault) and the manager brought out a fresh order (minus the nuts) very quickly. Brittany conversed with the four kids at our table throughout the meal. They loved her!   All of our food was tasty. We had the pancakes, croissant French toast, honey chicken biscuit, waffles, the breakfast platter, a burger and turkey sausage. I didn't hear a single complaint. Everyone enjoyed their breakfast. Oh and the icy orange juice was a nice touch! We received our food promptly and everything was fresh and hot. Next time we are in Charlotte we will be sure to stop in again.

tTyiClmnYcv9XjUX1wfWlg.text: This will become your "go to" diner! You'll want to take your out of town/new to town friends and family for this culinary experience! Fried chicken and waffles - with a syrup and tabasco lesson, crab cake cordon blue, biscuits and gravy, meatloaf with mashed potatoes, etc, etc, etc. Bring your appetite!!!

4ajTwglmA7gywEehZSwtIg.text: A pleasant place.  Tables were not to crowded together so you could visit easily.  Lots of booths for those who like them.  Laid back vibe from people who work there. Food was good and portions were plentiful for the price.  My only issue is with the music played.  First off it was louder than it needed to be and what 'diner'  plays heavy metal music/punk rock!  It just didn't fit for the theme or the clientele present.

aSxbbIQ1R2D_lvCKCiSGDA.text: I live right behind here and visit here frequently! Absolutely love the meatloaf, their chicken is amazing as well! You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu.

bSCoFw_Rvdwlfllu90SOgg.text: What a good decision! I was only in town for the day and it was around lunch time ish so I looked a brunch place and this is what popped up for me. It was easy to find and well put together. I really wanted to try the chicken and waffles but, my figure told me otherwise, so I went for the corned beef with red potatoes and pouched eggs, an order of turkey sausage on the side. (Lots of of protein here) I drizzled both eggs over the corned beef with some salt and pepper and dove it in. Never had pouched eggs but they were fantastic with the corned beef. It didn't get cover everything so the next time I will have four eggs instead of two. A glass of sweet tea to wash it all down; that had me fat and happy for the rest of the day. This meal wasn't too heavy at all. I made a three hour drive after this and wasn't even close to being sleepy. Don't know if it was all the protein or the portion size was just right. However, it was good eats!

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

vGNZnIx6C0IQ9d1KOlc4IQ.text: Great breakfast spot! Quick, friendly service, and creative menu!

7cjY6YF_trlk86V1gLbELA.text: A real diner.  At least to me, as it is open 24/7, has a huge menu, offers breakfast, lunch and dinner and you can order whatever is on the menu regardless of what time of day you are there.  i would say it serves up American common or American comfort foods.  The basics plus some.  REMEMBER to look at the rear wall as they have a chalk-posted special board.  It took me three visits before I noticed it, so it kind of sneaks up on you, especially after you have already ordered your meal(s).  Agh!  Service is fast and friendly.  Servers treat you as a friend, along with being efficient and diligently taking down your substitutes or special requests.  And the kitchen comes through quickly and the orders come in as you requested and hot.   The location suffers being on that horribly busy section of Hwy 51/Pineville-Matthews Road, so exiting the parking lot is a right turn only situation.  Entering you have to know where you are so you can get through the traffic into the center turn lane or into the right lane, depending on your direction of travel.  Portions are very generous.  Wife had their bacon club sandwich and we gaped at the 8 slices of bacon inside.  I ordered the Metro Club and it was so thick with meat and cheese that I had to compress it to bite into it.  Both of those sandwiches are a great deal to eat and delicious.   Breakfasts are what I think breakfasts, American breakfasts, should be.  Three egg omelets and you name what you want in them.  Coffee continuously flows into your never empty cup.  And...best of all:  THEY SERVE REAL HASH BROWN POTATOES!  Yes, a miracle now-a-days with restaurants offering pan fried chunks of potato but calling them hash browns.  To me that is such a rip-off and those restaurants throw away lots of so-called hash browns every day.  But not at Metro Diner where the hash browns are what they are called and are very good.  You can tell that I really like hash browns.  And you can order them as a side or with your side of French fries.  A superlative option for a carbohydrate addict.  Good place all around.  As I work my way through the menu I can see the potential of more than three stars.

vlvXvYKIkN2N3q8u3bvCvA.text: Great diner located just down from Carolina Place Mall. We arrived around 7:30 for a late dinner (they close at 8 during the week), we we're promptly greeted and seated in a booth. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu items. I ordered a Belgian Waffle, my husband ordered eggs with sausage and bacon, and our son got the kids chicken fingers with fruit. Our food arrived quickly and was delicious. The chicken fingers tasted just like fried chicken! The waffle was golden with just the right amount of crispiness on the outside and fluffy in the middle - make sure you try the strawberry butter with your waffle. I shared my husband's bacon, which was perfectly cooked. I will definitely be back to try the crossiant french toast!

3vlMlnjcSiqodIInWxcrzw.text: i always go to eat at the metro only last time the waiter accidentally overcharged me on an item that was supposed to be part of the meal and not an extra. other then that the food is superb and so is the great service! michael. however i will be very sure this does not happen ever again!

3WP5ijqmBtBmqgzuANjuYw.text: The fried chicken is the bomb diggity! I recommend the chicken and dumplings and the turkey pot pie.

DDC6fj2yjHHSr0YZu6H7JA.text: I had a great experience at the Metro Diner. The food was amazing. I had the Chicken and Waffles and I was more than delighted. On top of the great food, I had a great customer service experience. My waitress, Briana, was stellar and a pleasure to be around. And the entire staff was very friendly. I recommend to anyone visiting the Charlotte area to make a visit.

71zmf_RS7_YYJ8QY22JoCw.text: My son saw the chicken and waffle picture and had to come here. So we took a breakfast date and sure enough, it was amazing. Best chicken & waffle we've ever had. I tried the hot sauce & syrup sauce with the chicken and the waitress was right, it's good!  We also ordered the San Francisco egg Benedict which was tasty as well. The service was great and the place has a nice laid back atmosphere.

BJFLSl1PtWJPZgq2E8qYMg.text: I had the country fried steak and scrambled eggs and bacon. It was delicious. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. I have no complaints! When in the area I will definitely be back!

evrorfPowg1zAdaTBNntwg.text: Absolutely delicious! We've been looking for a breakfast place since we've moved here a year ago. This is it! Fantastic food and excellent wait staff. Ryker made our experience here very enjoyable.

6BI6Ak4oqptWEj0SJ1LZvw.text: Went there for late lunch. The chicken is divine! And they give you a 1/2 chicjen.. big enough to feed a small village! I love that the mashed spuds are not fussy. Just plain, mashed with no sauce or drippy butter. The roasted veg was equally as good. Hubs had the roasted turkey and he said it was quite tasty. The people we went with had meatloaf ( he said it was not bad) and the other had the chicken salad and said it was really good.  I definitely want to go back for breakfast.

nHEfWcEpKKXWC9zKIx2KFA.text: Metro Diner had been on my hit list for a while.   Finally made it this week and found the menu overwhelming. So many choices, so little time.   Liz, was our "cruise director" (waitress) and the journey left us wanting more. Comfortable environment, quality ingredients with biscuits and gravy that will leave you begging for more!  A definite breakfast "do over" - now to sample lunch and dinner too.  Started in Jacksonville in 1992, glad that you've come to CLT.

Nml4nHSTO99ghkYSsBmu1A.text: Service was excellent.  Manager/owner is very friendly.  I sat at the bar and watched the "well oiled" process come together.  Everything that was cooked looked great. The food was  great. They have a vast menu for breakfast lunch and dinner. The staff seem to enjoy their jobs.  I had the 2 stack of panckes, hashbrowns, scrambled eggs and sausage.  It is a nice little find on Pineville Matthews.   Charlotte is in need of great breakfast places...and this one provides it all. Also, breakfast is available all day!!!

5ibLstdfsxYPMmFQ_MYGYQ.text: Very good find. The Yo Hala was delicious! Best French toast item I've ever had. The huevos rancheros was good but wasn't really a breakfast item even though it was listed under breakfast entrees. The waitress was friendly and down to earth. Nice, homey atmosphere overall. Not crazy about their coffee or orange juice. If you could overlook their drink options, the food is very good. The only other complaint I have is to make the menu a little more breakfast friendly on the weekend mornings. Worth a repeat visit though!

Vz0zmviWyBay0gRTE-6ixg.text: My boyfriend and I ended up going 2 days in a row because there were so many meals we wanted to try! Breakfast was delicious. We got the Bissell and corn beef hash meals and everything was great! Today we came back for lunch and did the veggie wrap (add chicken) with Mac and cheese and the pork chop sandwich. Once again, not disappointed! We sat at the counter and it was mesmerizing  (and distracting). Definitely a new spot for us!

B1ymlZ_HqfqqGj8ZLwjdhw.text: Went here for Sunday brunch. They were super busy so we sat at the bar facing the kitchen. I had the Yo Halla on the Square-- challah French toast with bananas and cream cheese mixture inside and covered in berry compote. Amazing! My friend had the chicken and waffles. We're taking like a half chicken!  You can get your non-alcoholic drinks-- coffee, tea, soft drinks-- at an area close to the front.  I want to go back to try dinner!

yrC23Lt4fwcxRbyQzAKSEw.text: I love breakfast. I've eaten at many of the breakfast places around the city, and this is definitely in my top 3 favorite. The food is solid and the service is top notch. The location, in a strip mall on pineville-Matthews rd was a turn off to me at first, but I quickly got over myself on that, because it's just that good. Do yourself a favor and try it out if you haven't already!

G-Ov42OJAOgVpDzGmLsUhg.text: Typical diner environment. Always a wait on the weekends. Huge portions. You will not leave this place hungry.

hyiwH3H6Rzur9teV4pUH4A.text: Went there on Sunday around 11:45 and had a wait of about 40 minutes but it was well worth it! I had the chicken and waffles and it was crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The table also had croissant French toast, chicken dinner and a daily special called peach yohala. All great! The service was friendly and attentive, too.

dK1UOC6JNkIphVZlhY6Q_A.text: This is my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Best breakfast and lunch. Great, quick service. Sitting at the bar is the best because you get to watch all of the food come out. The weekly specials are always changing so there's always something new and amazing to try. I'm obsessed.

2vyB1ie_7tpLkebYXVcmDw.text: Friendly staff.  Fast service.  Good comfort food and specials.  Would recommend for breakfast.  Plan on coming back to try it out for dinner.

IX6JviRxubeCvDM5RuJ2xw.text: Great atmosphere,  friendly staff. Our waitress was great. I had chicken and waffles, which my 10 month old enjoyed as well. Batter on the chicken was a little salty for my taste, but the chicken was moist and freshly cooked. Waffle was soft and fluffy, and it comes with strawberry butter. Sophie had shrimp and grits. She thought the grits could've been thicker and a little more kick to the dish,  but otherwise good flavor. Can't wait to bring the 7 yr old, bc he loves chicken.  Looking forward to trying other dishes here.

KHlEywjavcG7j6O6vZoJvg.text: Great food, great service, great price. I got the two egg platter with hash browns and toast and it was huge! The scrambled eggs were cooked to my liking and the hashbrowns were very crispy.

K0uJ98tM_jL5QabRB3WkfA.text: Really enjoyed My food. And our server was very nice. I loved the veggie wrap!!!! So good. I'll get that again & again. They now serve Mimosa's too!

MxRYg5OmvVg7yLS5csP3Mg.text: Great breakfast spot! Serves full menu all day. Love the self-serve coffee bar and daily specials. We've quickly found ourselves becoming regulars:)

NzHQB94tW38rD-rITMGw5A.text: Decided to give Metro another chance. So glad we did! Very friendly staff, food well prepared and a fair price. Will visit again the next time we're in Charlotte.

udcbrDi7E8xtTzalj2eC8g.text: I got three words for ya: CHICKEN AND WAFFLES. Also, I love that strawberry butter more than certain relatives of mine.

ViS7htK7nQhQABNmaDjzMQ.text: This place was absolutely amazing!! Liz was our server and she was very attentive and well knowledgable! My husband and I ordered omelettes( American and western omelettes) and were very pleased! The hash browns were amazing and so were my grits! Keep up the great work!

fXu0l7Sl0oZA_HNrLp_KHQ.text: Great breakfast!!! They just open, and it's a MUST TRY!!! Staff is friendly and food is tasty, Easy to find! They are in the Staple shopping center, and next to Mr. Tokyo. I will bring some friends with me next time!! Keep up the good work!!

vACwJz_me3b6V2JqKx52LQ.text: Great food with exceptional service!  Had family from out of town and we decided to come here and it was by far the best breakfast experience I've had yet in Charlotte.  I will definitely be returning, Brie was amazing!

cYByueQfL5aDMnn8l5DkLg.text: My husband found this cute little Diner so we decided to give it a try. LOVE. This reminds me of the diners back in NY. We ordered a lot of food to try and share.  All the food we ordered was hot and delicious. The staff were all nice and helpful. Very family friendly, my kids asked to go back. We will definitely be going back here for future breakfasts.

BISXt2iR85N69R3J_3-dVg.text: This is one of those places that's so bad but so good. The food is delicious and the portions are huge. I think I rolled out of the door!! I ordered the chicken and biscuits. It's a great whole in the wall place!

NaipIZr-K3gp1OQ_EzDyzQ.text: Decided I didn't want to cook tonight so we roamed around trying to figure out where to eat.  Honestly we decided on a nearby sushi restaurant but the wait for a table was unbearable.   So we said let's try Metro.  We were extremely happy with our choice. The staff was very friendly - we even had a visit by the manager ensuring all was to our liking.  The portions were overly generous, almost to a fault.  But the upside was we had a few meals leftovers.  Whatever you order you should expect excellent comfort food.  Do yourself a favor and try the cornbread waffle, a huge winner in my book.

AAytlJp8uJDaVNQpnwgakQ.text: Great food but there's always a wait. Always!  Metro provides a diner feel with a touch of large fast casual. The menu is massive. If you're dining with picky eaters, it's a great option as everyone can find something to enjoy.

4m7DsEvsYGvfhnWJlj8v0g.text: Great atmosphere. Feels like an ol time diner.  Everything smells great when you walk in, even coming up from the sidewalk the smell hits you and you know your foods going to be good.  Ordered spicy chicken biscuit and a plain waffle.  Gf ordered San Francisco Benedict (which I tasted and was fantastic)

8DpDZ-rlkEdSISQvezT8AA.text: Metro Diner is the sort of place I've been looking for for a long while. When you don't want to go all the way into Uptown for Midnight, I can head here to Metro and be just as pleased with the food.  I stopped in Sunday morning before the after-church rush started and had a comfy seat at the counter. Facing into the kitchen, I was able to watch the food being prepared, see how clean and organized it is, and watch the meals be finalized before being brought out to diners. Interesting!  I stuck with simple stuff, the corned beef hash and poached eggs. They were *perfectly* poached and the hash was much more beef than potatoes. A nice large portion! Toast was done nicely and my meal was excellent. Great service, too.  I'll be looking forward to my return to Metro.

1Bgq2vTxYigIbiBZbSRdlA.text: I finally took the hubby here. I had been to a Yelp event, but this was my first time on a normal night. It was very busy, but a hostess greeted us and sat us right away.   It seemed like after that, service was a little slow. People were running food like crazy, but it was just busy.   The food is awesome. Having tried a lot of the menu already, I decided to try the turkey plate. It was amazing. The turkey was tender and topped with a savory gravy. Sides included mashed red potatoes which were fluffy and buttery and sauteed squash and zucchini.  This may have been my favorite part of the dish. Not too buttery or overcooked and some crunch. It was so good, I wondered if they did Thanksgiving meals to go.  My husband ordered the Holy Divoli, which has been featured on DDD so you know it has to be crazy. This is no ordinary cheeseburger. They take two grilled cheese sandwiches that have bacon and tomato and use those as the bun! Then you have a very generous burger patty with a homemade pickle relish. And it comes with a side of fries. He wasn't able to finish.   If you're looking for comfort food and large portions, come here!

FA1osY0lQ2LfIN-EepGO6w.text: Super Delish!!  So I ordered some breakfast to go so that I could speed race to my morning appointment. I walked in and thought the decor was super cute. It was like a cool combination of a new school diner with an old school touch. Folks that entered were told to have a seat and someone would be right over to assist them.  I ordered the Chicken and Waffles, listen here:  Chicken: You get an entire Half chicken, fried to the high heavens, hot, juicy, and perfect to fill your daily regret slot. This chicken was sooooooooo scrumptious! Seasoned to perfection. I didn't even consider the body fat repercussions! Holla.  Waffle: Nicely done basic waffle. The strawberry butter accompaniment was life.  I'll be back again and again.

JKFx-Mc56eeVsDoPfowI5g.text: Nice place. The wait to be seated isn't long and they bring you your food fast. Which is delicious I had the chicken and waffles. Big portions!!!

cA69t2mIKON3DtaE60mVAQ.text: Second time for charm, much better experience from the first visit.  Went to breakfast this morning, and clearly not as busy as the first time.  Flying solo, sat at the counter, which brings back memories of diners up north-comfort and home.  The food was good and the service also much better.  Loved talking with the chef. Went safe with a ham and cheese omelette, which came with hash browns and I also went with a biscuit. Everything was good, and the biscuit was huge!  I will come back and give their Eggs Benedict a try.  Arrived at 9, seated by the kitchen, seems like we were forgotten.  Had to look for someone to serve us, been here a half hour, have coffee, but no food yet.  After 20 minutes, finally got food, no one has come around to ask about our meal, no refill on coffee.  I ordered the Corn beef hash -- cooked on flat top, was crunchy.  I wouldn't order again.  My friend had the breakfast sandwich, which was cold, probably because it took 20 minutes to get food.  First time here,  not sure if I would come back. It's like our table was forgotten.  It want that busy, so service should have been better,  and food, nothing to write home about--very disappointed.  The manager, Keith, was very apologetic and does seem to care, and our waitress Sha was good--she was doing damage control.  We provided our feedback--let's see.

f1mvxhrcex8vZHzZ1Thc0Q.text: Good food with huge portions. We can usually get an entree to share or get 2 and have plenty leftover to take home. The BBQ waffle stack is amazing.

rMt6XXjLmPs0gUjhOTriAw.text: Great food, pancakes are colossal, eggs are fresh and service is awesome!  Kirin was our server, and he was very good

ho1TiiuYZHln6cHLUzdmMQ.text: I don't typically like diners but this place rocked. I'm only not giving it 5 stars because the wait time each time I've been here has been super stupid and I know the food us the reason.   Chicken and waffles was good as hell. Strawberry butter and fresh cook to order chicken. Crab cake benedict was exactly what I expected. They also had mimosas1  Strip lot...plenty of parking. It's a diner so diner prices. Friendly services and quick. No complaints here.

3_XaEr5WSpkAIIkHe6unSQ.text: About a year after opening I thought to give 'em another whirl.  I ordered a basic, straight-up, old school classic:  two eggs over easy, hashbrowns, sausage, and coffee.  Other than my eggs teetering on medium, they nailed it.  An added bonus is they serve Louisiana Hot Sauce, which I prefer over tobasco.  Yes.  Seems like they ironed out the wrinkles from before, so I heartily say, "Give 'em a whirl."  Another good diner to hang your hat while sipping hot Joe in a heavy, ceramic mug.

The food is pretty tasty but It's a little stuffy and pretentious for diner food and the cost reflects that. We really like their spin on shrimp and grits and the french toast too. My pescetarian sister had a hard time finding "the good stuff", there's veggies and such but there's still meat in a lot of the things, like the grits for example. Overall a fairly good diner in South Charlotte.

wCJ6D2asD5NT4nz8ARAAEw.text: This was a super lunch experience we had, the restaurant seems orderly, clean, uniform and feels pleasant right away. We came in for lunch and had fast service with a pleasant smile, our server was kind and helpful, beautiful lady. Our lunch was True to metro diner standards, we had a monte cristo, a croissant breakfast and a texan burger, all marvellous.

Grits were average but the eggs were fluffy, the bacon was crispy and the whipped butter on the waffle was perfect.  I'll be back.

Vyu7FpmQQas7suNtjyv2mQ.text: Can you say crab omelette?!? Yes, this place had it and they do it well.  There is an awesome fried chicken and waffle plate.  The service is great! Friendly!  I haven't had anything that I did not like!

QxserHtkuhiDwr4XZwi0_g.text: This is a place where it does not look impressive from the outside but you have to come inside to discover the gem. We were greeted by a friendly staff, and the waitress was very pleasant. We ordered crab cake eggs Benedict and other typical breakfast dishes. We all thought the food was delicious. Highly recommended if you have not tried this place yet!

fEVzAo6nx4RrrYMTVz0WoQ.text: If you ask your friend what do you wanna eat and they say "I don't know" just bring them here! Metro Diner is great the servers are very friendly and the food is great, you will not be disappointed. I've been here a couple of times and I can definitely say it's worth it. They've got flavored teas and the flavor changes every now and then. They also have a soup of the day but I've only seen it change twice hahaha but both the broccoli cheddar and the clam chowder were great. The meatloaf plate is awesome, I wish the chicken pot pie was a little more savory, it is a little bland in my opinion however still good. They recently added a Cajun chicken pasta and that has been my go to for a while! Metro Diner is great and I will keep going.

Mko6aEJ3fiAiulbhxfBK-A.text: I came here with my kids to order brunch. The wait was 40 minutes which wasnt too bad. They allowed me to get coffee while I waited which was really good. When we sat down the waiter was very nice to us. my kids ordered from the kids menu. they are 7, 9 & 10. they ordered the waffle meal. I ordered my food as well. the kids food came first and to my surpsie it was very very little serving. my kids were shocked that they didnt get any eggs or meat to go along with their meal. and by the time they were done eating they were still very hungry. As soon as they finished i finally got my pancakes. so you can imagine how long it took. but the rest of my meal (eggs,toast, hashbrowns, ham) hadnt came out yet. I didnt want to seem rude so i waited about 10 minutes and still nothing. So I finally waved down the waitress. she told me they had to cut my ham fresh. apparently i was the only person in the restaurant who ordered ham. But i smiled and said ok. about 5 minutes later she finally cane backe at this time i was ready to go so i asked for a to go box. I asked her if i can get a discount and she said of course. to my surprise i only got 2$ discount after waiting a total of 40-50 minutes for my whole mean to come out. The food was good but i doubt i will come back. the kids serving is too small and with 3 kids i could have filled them up better with a $3 happy meal from mcdonalds.

Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

bux6WuYIjEKmMSZzlnLvZg.text: This was our first time here and we'll definitely be back everything was great! Food and service and may i add that the chicken and waffles is a must try

pRnHEp-l_UlrM9QOPQxMXA.text: This place is he bomb .com I today we had the charleston shrimp and grits along with the kids Belgium waffle. The shrimp and grits were huge! Two ppl can eat off of it and you can order a half order. The waffle was light and fluffy and so so good. I'm definitely coming back again and again. There are so many other things I need to try.

qyuDfp09daVqZ_qOcqMynw.text: Expensive for low grade food and mediocre service.  This area needs a restaurant that serves good food at a reasonable price.

f0j4vsv2JYvHUTKAPcUmjw.text: Very very good Sunday breakfast spot! Good portion sizes, and very well made food. Parking is tight! And there's a wait once you check in. I wish I'd found this place sooner. Will come back

23UjHA6ViiBgEaze9NGaSg.text: Nice concept! Pineville needed a diner in the area. I was impressed with the coffee bar and authentic diner feel. My parents enjoyed their food. I had the shrimp and grits. It was not at all as delicious as they made it out to be. Extremely heavy on the gravy and couldn't tell the difference between the grits and the gravy. My son said the pancakes were rubbery.  The waitress was friendly and overly attentive. She was a little mixed up with food and drink, but it was busy. Seating was a little crowded and weirdly positioned. I won't say I won't go again but I will not be a regular

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

MNAkBZf86W-ntJLsqI9P7w.text: I really love this diner! The menu is more extensive than you might expect, and everything is wonderful in flavor, presentation, and temp. This place knows how to satisfy its customers! Staff is attentive, ambiance is vibrant, and their coffee is great always. Enjoy!

ISQW4H9acR_hf1s1Fc5chA.text: I stumbled across this place after church with a friend this week and boy, am I glad that we did?! Upon our arrival we were told that  the wait could be up to 50 min, but we only waited about 25. We reviewed the menu as we waited. I decided on the chicken and waffles. The chicken was seasoned and fried to PERFECTION (wing, leg, thigh, breast) and the waffle was nice and fluffy, the strawberry butter was an awesome touch as well. The manager made rounds about 2-3 times during our visit, checking in on several guests to make sure everything was ok. Our waitress, Alice, was amazing! Very personable and attentive. I'll be sure to return soon. I'm excited to visit the new location in huntersville as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

T6JJTbhWT58lPgwfUTuqxg.text: So disappointed! We went all family and friends for a dinner, we waited about thirty minutes before we got our table, on top of that another thirty minutes to get our food.. service was very rude! First and last time there

P3T1Q1B3Eb2ROiblK5UIfw.text: My family and I are big fans of Metro diner. It is a chain, so don't go in thinking it's a local thing - the decor is made to be retro, which we really like, but the positives to a chain restaurant are very much in play here... (I recognize there can be negatives to chains, but Metro hasn't showed those to negatives to us yet)! They're based out of Jacksonville FL and we've been to a number of their restaurants (including Vegas) and we can always rely on the staple items we enjoy for breakfast. My "mini" almost always gets the special pancake offering (cinnamon roll pancakes - O-M-G)! Hubs changes it up and rarely gets something that disappoints and I stick with the tried & True avocado toast with a side of egg-whites. I know, it sounds uber healthy and not filling enough, but trust me, the avocado toast is hardly wimpy and the bread is hearty! The Louisiana hot sauce is a great addition to any egg dish but it's spicier than Texas Pete or Tobasco, so be ready for some heat if you use it.... Overall, we're regulars and hope this place opens another location in Charlotte soon.

t-0C3uHweuHPkfFqg0Nflg.text: I absolutely love this diner. The service here is always impeccable, they wear smiles on their faces no matter how busy they are and I really like that. They're always attentive and paying attention to the table without me having to ask whether I need something or not they come to me. The food is always outstanding I have never had a bad meal here and I absolutely love coming here whether it's for breakfast, lunch or dinner it's always a good time. I highly suggest staying at anyone

3va98QNbMY3DZloxSXP9mQ.text: I love this place!! My favorite diner so far. The servers are nice (especially Ricker, hope I spelled that right) and you don't have to wait until you flag a server down to get you a refill you can get it yourself at the self serve station which is very clean. The food is amazing!! I suggest you leave your diet at home but it tastes fresh and like home cooking. The chicken and waffle with homemade strawberry butter is delicious if you need somewhere to start!

Ho8G6vSBUzELSyxwGUwS3A.text: The chicken and waffles here are so Good! Large portion  as well I will definitely be back.

xOofbgs-_yMMjJWapNpY8Q.text: Great diner. I had a delicious spinach salad with grilled chicken and my daughter had a burger cooked perfectly. Friendly staff and warm atmosphere.

xIYWcvi6NowY8FDspahA9w.text: Friendly service with lots of smiles all around. Husband and I stopped in for Saturday brunch. Portions are huge but awesome for the cost value. Food came out steaming hot and exactly the way we were hoping. Hubby had the party melt and I-rings. Tasted really good. I had the biscuit and gravy biscuit breakfast and while I couldn't finish it, would have if I had a spare stomach. Their self service drink bar is a fresh concept and helps to keep the servers focused on getting the food out to the tables faster.

MTyIEC3gnYlLDPvsqJdNCA.text: Amazing! The food is scrumptious! It's good home cooking and they serve breakfast all day. The service is prompt and friendly. The managers were checking on all the guests the entire time. We will be back!

CO9eq4-CmwJWaA0W83YbsQ.text: Good service had the hot turkey plate. Unfortunately it was extremely over salted. However server gave us a coupon to replace the dinner.   I will be happy to try them again !

dpFhzAvukXqQX3AsivchtQ.text: On our first visit last week, we loved it. Came back today and ordered the same thing and it wasn't close to the same quality or taste. First, the French Vanilla coffee had an odd taste. They got us new cups and it tasted the same. We kept it, but it had a watered down odd taste, unlike last visit where it was very good. Secondly, my husband asked for his eggs over medium and they were served over hard. The manager came to check on us and we explained that he ordered his eggs over medium etc. He said he would get him some new over medium eggs, no problem. He returned with sunny side up eggs. We just said thank you, kinda shocked he didn't know the difference. Everyone was friendly, not the same vibe as our first visit though. We are just disappointed that the experience was so different than our first visit. We both ordered the huevos rancheros and it was a totally different presentation and flavor.

V2RIO76Endp-p2n0sAZ91g.text: This is some satisfying home cooking  food..The spicy chicken biscuit is amazing!!! And I love the self serve drink bar..

9jhFSLhVgZE3ZHUUSBem7Q.text: We are regular customers of the Metro Diners,  in Pineville and Matthews and the service is usually pretty good with friendly and attentive staff Today, we were at the Pineville location and our experience was disappointing.  Coffee came without a spoon to stir in sugar,  steak was served without a steak knife nor steak sauce was offered, toast was burned and the server took away my husband's plate and silverware without asking if he was done, how did she expect him to eat his Mac and cheese side? Each time we mentioned was what wrong or missing,  she gave a smirk and walked away. And then she told us, "next time you come, I won't take away your silverware" Hopefully, Metro Diner will train their staff better.

nYZfOjfVOZkxs9mJ7yP1vw.text: This is the 2nd time I've been here. The first time we went fir breakfast.  Then, I got huevos rancheros. They were to die for! This time I had the fried chicken plate with mashed potatoes and squash. This was excellent.  My group also had the Pittsburgh and philidelphia cheese steak sandos and the chicken and waffles. Every one loved what they got. The waitress was very helpful with her suggestions and the staff was very friendly.  I plan to make my 3rd time to the metro diner very soon!

M_yOJgSFRvjlLfcIcWJqBw.text: Had read really good reviews of Metro Diner, so tried it for dinner. Had not intended to order breakfast food, but certain things were so highly recommended that we decided to try them. I ordered the Crab Benedict, and wasn't disappointed. The hollandaise sauce was creamy, the eggs were perfect and the flavor combination was a winner. The crab was not lump crab, so don't expect Maryland quality crab meat. My husband, who normally does not order omelets, was tempted by the Meat Lover's omelet; he was pleasantly surprised- said it was great! Hash browns came with both our entrees and they were thin and crunchy- yum! The diner has a nice atmosphere with black and white tile floors, a counter with stools and  it was very clean. Nice crowd on Saturday at 5 with a large party in the back. Excellent service. The food is not inexpensive, but worth what you pay. I want to try the Turkey Pot Pie and Meatloaf, a few of their other recommended entrees. If you get a chance, try the Metro Diner!

628_2IkVUwrkqtIKdbTeMA.text: This place rocks!!  Great food, service, and atmosphere.  The pot pie is to die for.  Till next time.

d9i7xUIMLMm3gZYd-VU6vA.text: Enjoyed the breakfast BUT had 1 complaint. Eggs very well scrambled, bacon perfect, rye toast good and service was fine. However, the hashbrowns I recieived were overdone and tasted more like the potato sticks out of a can. Whether they sat around too long would just be conjecture on my part, but need to be improved!

jrjU6JS2OP0JMjobfLhVbw.text: Came here for the first time today and was quite impressed. First thing when you walk in, if you have to wait, they have a coffee bar so you can have a cuppa while u wait. After yiu get a seat the menu is pretty extensive nd covered all the bases. We got our normal biscuits and gravy app to test the wters and was delighted to get crispy biscuits with soft centers and yummy gravy.  Next was our meals, the breakfast pie with cheese grits . The pie had such great flavor, the cheese mixture was awesome. The grits were cooked perfectly. I got the corned beef hash and I was so happy. The hash was real slow cooked corned beef that was very on point. Along with crispy potatos (like I asked) and perfectly cooked poached eggs. The sourdough bread ws lso on point. The staff was inviting and friendly and there was plenty of coverage for  busy morning. We even chatted with an owner and was delighted to hear the back story of the new place. We will return again Esp to try the chicken and waffles and shrimp and grits :)

41E4gf2ZSgyFeUihmnKlXw.text: Just the first try.  A big steak egg and cheese omelet with fruit.  Met the manager and chatted with staff.  Extremely hopping atmosphere.  Definitely return.

wjJUs8-SOvukVelk-JFfGw.text: Love, love, love Metro Diner!  Great menu- huge portions.  So happy to have this place nearby.  Yummy food and probably the best part is yet to come....,Bloody Mary's are on their way to the menu!

gXdHq92iwqxQ04MrOhZJxg.text: Great service, great food and they don't keep you waiting! My kind of spot! I ordered the fish and chips! It was delicious! My husband ordered the croissant French toast and he demolished it! The servers were pleasant and the food came out very quickly and was prepared wonderfully!

xny0QeRwEuBZxxixU0UM6A.text: Great diner food.  Best corned beef hash in town. Great staff. Love breakfast all day.

rWm-t1QhmH1eSV616N96ZQ.text: What a great addition to South Charlotte!! I had the chicken salad salad, and it was outstanding. The portion was more than enough! Our waitress was kind and helpful and the service top notch. My son had the Huevos Rancheros and he scarfed it down! The portions are huge and the service fast and friendly. You should try it!

2HpjHkgrcVgoG4H9FHttAA.text: Had the fried chicken plate.  The chicken was terribly over cooked.  I should have sent it back.  Fried chicken is normally golden brown, this was dark dark brown.  I am surprised they plated it.  The mashed potatoes, veggies and biscuit were fine.

5q2hYoAM42StQJeyqZEZqA.text: Chicken and waffles are great service was great. Also the place was clean. It reminds me of the ones in Jacksonville Florida. I would recommend this place to anyone searching for a great brunch

GYnmm4A5XapRl12obbAtKw.text: Great addition to Charlotte!  I have been going to the Metro Diner in Jacksonville for years and was excited to see a location open in Pineville.    I have been to the Pineville location twice and both visits were great.  The server was knowledgeable and attentive.  Food was prepared quickly and was delicious.  Huevos Rancheros is as good as it gets.  Several takes on Eggs Benedict that others in my party really enjoyed.  I'm not sure if the Breakfast Pizza was removed from the menu at all locations or just the newer ones, but I would love to see it added.

gau-Rhah_RBLM_SNLpTxuA.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my first visit to Metro diner. The food was delicious and the customer service was even better. I went with my young son, teenaged niece and nephew on a packed Friday evening.  It was about a 15 to 20 minutes wait for a table so we decided to stay in matthews vs riding to the Charlotte location which expressed no wait when I called. I got the chicken dinner which was absolutely delicious. More than possibly expected to eat in one meal. My nephew opted for a bacon croissant with home fried potatoes. With my little one getting chicken tenders with fries. The only person to experience an issue with their meal was my niece. Her burger was incorrect and upon realization the server (Jennifer) apologized and tried correcting the problem. Moments later a man appearing to be in management came over to apologize and explained how they do not work that way.  He promptly removed the burger from the bill to our amazement. We didn't ask nor expect for that to happen. Aside from the good being delicious the service will take them far. Treat yourself while in the area.  I look forward to experimenting with the menu on future visits.

C-asDExvnW6CATfmvPGp5w.text: The food here is mediocre to good, depending on when you go...but wtf is up with the wait staff??? Went here with my Mr. About 4 times: the first time was their first Saturday open and it was awesome! Super friendly wait staff, Manager was super-schmoozy but over all nice and the food was on point! Second time with my 10 yr old, food was good but prices seemed like they almost doubled from our last visit...(shrugs)...fried chicken is the truth so we sucked it up... But the last two visits: I swear reality set in hard! Third visit for breakfast on an average Sat. Morning: 1 hr. wait...ok, but then another 20 min to have our order taken  and ANOTHER 40+ to get our food! Really?!?  People that came in after us got seated and we're eating before our food came. Our waiter was a space cadet!! He looked like he had a longgggggg night!  He was wandering around, kept staring at us and taking food all over the restaurant except to our table. Manager came over to apologize and gave free meal coupons because he was embarrassed. We swore we'd never come back.   And then tonight we went back! Space cadet was in rare form, but our waitress was unnecessarily rude! I ordered a plate that had 1/2 fried chicken which was too much so my Mr. Decided he would take the dark meat and order pancakes and eggs. Ok. This bi*^h got and attitude and started treating us funky because she thought we were sharing my plate! Wait...What?!? The rest of the staff kept staring at us, god knows what she told them-she thought we couldn't afford a meal cuz we had to share so there goes her tip! It was crazy. WRONG THOT!    Got our check and tossed my Discover card at her like girl bye!! Thanks for the effed up service because she didn't have the courtesy to clarify our order. The service here is the worse and they need retraining. That was truly our last time. Ever.

Mn9mnbfb4hd-ZqoJiWiEgw.text: I'd give it a 3.5 if possible. Great server, manager, and cute diner counter seating. Good omelet, and crispy bacon (said my dining mate). But disappointing were the weak coffee, undercooked grits, and long wait time from ordering to receiving food. We liked it well enough to return soon for an even better experience, but probably not for breakfast.

qUQkB4U83WTiBZJHX7jGiQ.text: It was my fiance and I's first time here it I couldn't be happier! The chicken and waffles were AMAZING!!! Thank you Metro Diner for a great experience! We will be back for sure!!!

tlfDxylgTzvX3srO2PUaaw.text: The staff here is wonderful and the food is tasty. I've only been once but really enjoyed it. I got the meatloaf dinner and my husband had the biscuits and gravy. The waitress was especially nice to our child and even brought him a small dish of strawberries to hold him over before food arrived.

sdZPCHv3rjpYDOUH3ETaRg.text: Had breakfast there this morning. It was wonderful. The food was slow coming out, but considering it is Mother's Day I expected it. The food was very good and the manager stopped by to explain why the food was taking time. Will definitely go back!

B9JAk9vbnIsPOSPAJZfh8w.text: Absolutely Delicious!! I had the Chicken w/French Toast (substituted the waffles) .. Huge portion of food. I'm not sure of what type of batter they use for the fried chicken but OMG  Crispy and flavorful on the outside and Juicy on the inside.  I highly recommend this spot.

0jKHDeRfT0AQyW9YGjIzmQ.text: I was too excited to try your restaurant only to be disappointed...and it's unfortunate because it wasn't because of the food it was the to go person response to my concerns about being on hold for ten minutes irrelevant since her other in house guests come first?!? I'm just in disbelief. And the sad thing is that my coworkers are in love with your establishment.

ZHcFRr_rGQ2UOBK-UlDkXA.text: Adorable little diner. The food was absolutely delicious. I will definitely go again and again.

NRNVsu-YeBr54s0BtrZ0bQ.text: Good food, friendly service, and breakfast all day!  We'll definitely be back!!  Thanks!

bkbSaFiNvA3m9imBRqqRKg.text: Kenny and his team are fantastic! They make you feel right at home! Everything that we've had on our two visits here has been delicious! If you are feeling like some home cooked food- try the meatloaf platter!  The strawberry cheesecake stuffed waffles,that were a special today, were out of this world! There is something for everyone's tastes! Fantastic service! Fantastic food! Fantastic prices! You cannot beat that!

_2R76iPzsDJVzQsvArHIxw.text: Everyone is so happy here. Customer service A+++ AND the food very very good!! Presentation nice too. A truly pleasant surprise and experience. Highly recommend. PS Sausage gravy and biscuits can't be beat!

6E_FIwX-IBlmaDDFgWSvSg.text: Chicken and waffles were great. My daughter ordered a grill cheese with a side of mac & cheese, only suggestion is the servers need to ask if anything other than cheese is wanted in the sandwich. She got a tomato in it. We were very surprised to see the sandwich wasn't charged after she said she didn't like it. We will be coming back.

6BZowd_vvLEP8a1tANOW2g.text: The first time to diner for Breakfast, service was great but food was awful.The corn beef was just potato and some beef while son egg dry, and bacon overcook. Offer change corn beef but other items probably the same. Would not recommend for Breakfast while there for Breakfast menu but disappointed.

HJVWH0xQzcSZ4Gx8_Nz5dg.text: Went for dinner with my husband. The menu has a good variety of items, I was tossed between having breakfast or dinner. I decided on the fish n chips but had the mac n cheese as my side vs the fries. It was delicious! Fish was good, had a light batter and the mac n cheese was excellent! My husband had the pastrami sandwich with mashed potatoes, big portions and it was very good! Someone next to us ordered the chicken n waffles and it looked awesome, we both said next time we need to order that :)).  The service was good, food came out pretty quickly and was hot and fresh. We will definitely be back!!

r-FDsIY5Ngt6wiircOr5RA.text: This was our first time eating at the Metro Diner. We knew ahead of arrival that we may have to wait - it's a popular place. We waited about 20 minutes, which wasn't bad for Sunday brunch. Our waitress, Sha, was very helpful and gave us great suggestions. There is a good variety from which to choose for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Our food was delivered hot and delicious.

iMCDIwgpROdQtB9ywgaO2A.text: All around a nice place but beware.  This place only gets 2 stars.  I went with my uncle for breakfast.  We both ordered western omelettes and requested they make them frittata style where they beat the items into the eggs rather than fold the omelette with the items sitting in the middle.  So when the bill comes I see a $1.00 frittata charge for each omelette.  I questioned the waitress and she claims she didn't even know that it cost extra which I believe because she didn't mention it when we ordered it that way.  Now mind you, we didn't request extra ingredients.  All it takes is to beat the items into the eggs.  Why would that cost an additional 1.00 per omelette?  It doesn't make sense.  I have yet to go back and I'm not sure I will.  I don't like nickel & dime-ing and this really upset me especially since their pricing is already on the high side.

IQOV_Tfgbvqbo1-8eIUCxw.text: Came to Metro Diner for a quick brunch and I have to say that not only was the staff extremely courteous but the food was everything I had read and more.  The meal came out in a short amount of time and was delicious. Shelly, our waitress did an awesome job of checking on us before,during and after the meal.

f2jNnjVzVfGbw5fqvvXhfg.text: I ordered to-go, so I can't comment on the atmosphere or service, but the food was absolutely delicious. My husband got the chicken and waffle and I got a waffle with fruit on top. The portion for the chicken and waffle was HUGE, and the other waffle was a perfect, thick and fluffy Belgian waffle. Side note: the strawberry butter that comes with the chicken and waffle was heaven. This is my new regular breakfast spot. LOVE!

yRv2WUnElCf8tnsUOajs5g.text: First visit today!  Outstanding food and service.  Kirin was our server and was so helpful in recommending options for us.  My husband had the meatloaf and I had breakfast.  Everything was delicious and we are so happy we found this gem!

E5mWMCEpZbQ6b3hH67SLTA.text: Just had a great lunch here. I had the fried chicken plate- it was crispy and moist, with a nice taste. My friends had the meatloaf and pork loin sandwich and both were happy with their choices. All the staff were friendly and professional. I will definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. American burger

mWhrF6sq1byPXmAl76MPxw.text: Get here early cause the wait can be long. Long waits mean good food most of the time and Metro Diner does not disappoint. Please try the chicken and waffles, it will change you life. LOL

id9WtEhAgttlfvxsh9x1pA.text: Really solid breakfast for bacon, eggs, pancakes and toast. No really stand outs nor disappointments.   The atmosphere is neo-cafe that is a touch of old school with faux artist flare.  The service was very friendly and kind.  While there was no wait for sitting, the wait for the food was rather long. However, I don't know how many orders was before ours. I mean we could a come rather at the end of a rush....  I will revisit to try other dishes.

ZNWOvUrdLOh_P5TK4VEFTQ.text: Ehh.  Diner food. Servers last Sunday night were not attentive at all. Probably not return.

xMXWqSSX7cbY70gLm0bEzA.text: Food was great!! Had the shrimp and grits! Parking was easy. Fast and friendly service!

6otY2maj3z6HrIpoVPM_hA.text: This place won't disappoint! Breakfast all day everyday and portions for forever! Prompt courteous service and staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy

bCpE9PIG_16QhmFb3ZuOwA.text: Stopped in here the other day for lunch.  It's smaller than the Matthews location, so it probably gets busy at peak times.  We had salads.  Good as always.  I think their menu is much the same as Matthews so I knew what to expect.    Service was also very good.

D5RSnnQ7X76kZ-vO8LjY1A.text: If you have never been you need to soon. I first found them in Jacksonville FL, where they got their start. I didn't know they were a chain. Good comfort food at reasonable prices. Well worth your time.

pjS2R6LCS0o6c67KciZzog.text: If you go here, please try the chicken and waffles. I'm not sure how they make the chicken so crispy and delicious even I rave about it (not the biggest fried chicken fan, see), but they do.  The wait staff is always excellent and fun and friendly, and the level of comfort in their comfort food is beyond compare.

5wZKAnjlE10FxCuh7ZHi3w.text: Unfortunately the worst diner experience  ever. Food was not even hot when served, pasta was over cooked and sauce watered down. The waitress came once during the whole meal to check and that was the ending of the meal. Very sad experience..

DjpruV22hHPyWrIiwhVaGw.text: I was headed to Waffle House and drove right by it when I noticed their sign. I drove a little ways past it to turn around but when I was making my turnaround,  I noticed Metro Diner. Now, you must know that I'm a big Diner foodie and when I see one that has a whole bunch of cars out front,  then I pretty sure that I found a good one. Well, I found a good one! Went in and was greeted by a very friendly staffer, who immediately sat me. I chose to sit at the bar area so I could watch the cooks prepare the meals. I was in for breakfast, so I opted for the Classic Eggs Benedict. It came with hashbrowns. Both were delicious. I'll be back!!

GDdsckqOWr2zSuqvp0lfQA.text: OMG this is going to be one of my most frequent places. I love this little spot on Pineville Matthews road. The menu is large because they offer brunch basically as well as breakfast and dinner. Mimosas and beer are options as well as wine. The portion sizes are unbelievable I promise the chicken and waffles plate had a half of chicken on it. The dinner is not a loud space even though its not a huge space. Our food was really good I had the holy davoli burger but changed it to turkey check out the pics it had egg on it which was a extra buck but worth it. the burger was in between two grilled cheese sandwiches with slaw tomato and bacon. The sandwich was huge of course I couldn't eat it all. My brother got the breakfast burger which had hash browns and egg on it he almost killed over trying to eat it all. check out the pics to see the food. My next trip im going to try the berry stuffed French toast

EcSwuEAhRJQenpCA-iGV9g.text: 1st time at Metro Diner, and it will not be the last! Food was super & for the price, we were shocked at the portions. We honestly could have shared one dish. The service was exceptional! Adam did an awesome job! Definitely check them out! You won't be disappointed!

IVmF06CL01UpNYU_o4-KwQ.text: Very very delicious breakfast/brunch place in Pineville :-)  It's a neat little spot right next to Mr. Tokyo's Japanese restaurant and there were some people waiting outside. I felt like they weren't just there to enjoy the sun so I asked and they said it was the line for Mr. Tokyo. I let out a huge sigh of relief... btw it was 1:15 and the site said they closed at 2:30 so I didn't know what to expect!  Service was a decent speed, I think it took about ten minutes after I sat down for a server to come get me some water, and that was more than enough time to look at the menu. I won't deduct a star because that wasn't a big deal to me.  I ordered the cinnamon swirl pancakes with a spicy chicken biscuit and it came out in I think six minutes. Extremely fast and it looked phenomenal!! Check out my pics for some instant gratification. Pancakes were amazing... they had pecan chunks on them with some delicious frosting in the middle. The biscuit was awesome too! I wish it was a little spicier but that's just me.  Pancakes were $9.95 or something and he biscuit was like $4. Definitely doable prices.  Kristi was my server and she was very friendly. Thanks so much Kristi!

MANzPi9ypkuYirmr6qYGMw.text: I'm very disappointed in Metro Diner today. My family and I usually go in the morning for breakfast. The AM Staff is wonderful.  We decided to go in the afternoon for a late lunch. BIG MISTAKE!!! We were seated right away but the waiter /waitress took over 10 minutes for someone to come take our order.  No one showed up, and the staff that was there acted like they were al on break. No one even came it offer us water or take a drink order. So we left and went to Stacks.  Better Food, Better Service.  Memo to metro: Be careful not to let a bunch of lazy kids ruin your reputation.

a9i3FYLJeyQJl5BW88LwGg.text: Great spot for breakfast/brunch!  We find ourselves going here almost everyone weekend on either Saturday or Sunday!  They have daily $3 mimosas and Bloody Mary's and I can tell you the mimosas are both tasty and strong.   They also have a soda and coffee bar you can help yourself too if they're busy and you're waiting to get seated, or you just decided you want a drink or refill mid-meal.  The food has been consistently good as well.  I usually go with the Huevos Rancheros, but I keep meaning to try their chicken and waffles.  Just can't look past that high calorie count on it.  If you see country fried steak on their specials for the day, it's quite good too!

hk_UyR6a2V3eqYkeZBkmSA.text: My first visit was wonderful. Friendly staff...Brianna was delightful! Clean facility. Food cooked to order quickly and it was lunch rush. Tried the lunch special Southwest Chicken Wrap with onion rings and it was fabulous. Fresh ingredients to boot. I can't wait to come back to try the breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Metro Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

a4L79q0yOvBo64OP7UMWYA.text: Metro Diner, from West Coast to East Coast, is just a no brainer for quality food that's not typical diner food!  Having just experienced Metro in Las Vegas, I was all in to get to this location while dropping guests off at nearby CLT Airport.  The food here is outstanding, and extremely fairly priced for nearly a farm to table experience!  My order of San Francisco Benedicts was a first for me, but after this experience, wont be the last!  Two English muffin halves with substituted sausage patties as the meat, two poached eggs, tomato slices, avocado slices, all covered in a rich hollandaise sauce!  The extremely well prepared Corn Beef Hash is served with two eggs done your way, potatoes, and delicious sourdough toast!  Perhaps the most outstanding thing they do here is their Fried Chicken and Waffles!  It's literally 1/2 a chicken that's battered and fried to perfection.  Served with a real Belgian waffle, not pancake mix, that's got a delicious strawberry butter jam for the accompanying spread.  There's protocol in place at each Metro Diner that's evident in the way you're greeted, apologies given when not greeted promptly, and the superb attitude throughout service!

-r65sF6msdmOnQRiwx4u2A.text: omnomnomnom!!! We ordered a Monte Cristo and croissant French toast. This Monte Cristo is how they should be made, fully battered and fried. It could use a white cheese, but the raspberry jelly was SOOOOOOO good! I would not get the croissant again though. It was good, but there were so many other options I would try!   Restaurant was clean and service was good and friendly. Would definitely recommend this place!

MOFXQ-nN8nHF6yPElk3hfA.text: Never disappointed no matter what I get from here. I love the fact they have a bar you can watch the kitchen from. I tend to get the mashed potatoes and salmon. I've had their chicken and waffles too and they're sooooooo good. Love the strawberry spread they have to offer. Gotta eat the chicken fresh. I went to both locations they have in Charlotte and all staff have been friendly. Definitely would recommend metro dinner over midnight diner , Waffle House or even ihop.

poGpahapd-uafb9ldIeOFA.text: First time eating there I heard a lot about this place so I gave it a try n was very disappointed.  I had 2 ask for napkins n a folk. Soon as I walked into the place, I was not greeted by the staff properly so I let that slide. So once I placed my order the guy took my card n walked off.  When I got 2 work that afternoon 2 eat my supper from them it had no taste n the bread was burned n hard 2 chew, I called 2 speak 2 the manager 2 let him know about my visit n he couldn't come 2 the phone. I gave the person my name n number n they never reached out 2 me so I won't go back.

xxUNTxN7vBZ_8Dba53_ZuQ.text: Great for diner food. Pancakes, chicken and waffles.  My husband loves it here. I am not a big fan of the hash browns. Usually a long line to get in.  But the line is quick and the service is very good.

jn1Mc87gxcfU20cPpS-45g.text: The food was delicious! The price was not at all bad for the food however, the wait for the food was a little long. Its well worth it. I give Metro Diner 4 stars because the waitress could have been better, she did not check on us throughout the time we were there and she gave us the bill before we were even done eating or even before asking if we needed boxes. She left a bad taste in my mouth. Despite that, I do recommend this restaurant.

rFwVvmI7YDaGHW59NS8odQ.text: I have now eaten at both of their locations around Charlotte. Breakfast on a Sunday AM in Matthews, and dinner in Pineville on a Saturday night.  If you have not eaten there,- stop what you are doing, and go there right now! This place is AMAZING!  A friend and I were out shopping in Pineville, and decided to stop and see how their dinners were.  In a word, our dinners were PERFECT!  My friend ordered the pot roast dinner with a side of broccoli  for about $12. I was going to order the beef tips over noodles, but at the last minute changed my mind and got the chicken parm,- also about $12. Both dinners were served promptly, and were perfectly cooked.  My chicken parm came with 3 chicken breasts (the menu said two). The breading was on the darker side, and my first thought was that they would be over cooked and dry. I was completely wrong! The chicken was anything but dry. It was not mushy either,- but you could cut it easily with just a fork. Delicious!  My friends pot roast was equally tender.  We each took about 1/2 of our meals home to eat later.  The waitress asked me if I would be interested in desert. They had an apple crisp, - and being a sucker for a good desert, I said yes.  I was expecting a small piece, - maybe 3 or 4 inch square.  What I got was basically an entire apple pie tin sized desert,- which was also outstanding.  For $8!  Metro Diner rocks!  I will be back to try the beef tips in the near future. The menu is quite varied. If you want a great meal and at a rock bottom price, look no further.

Kh8CPYmjTleenyzmyN6e6Q.text: Nicki was our sever and she was excellent. The service and food were wonderful. I tried the chicken and waffles and their signature sauce which for me I enjoyed. I tried the strawberry butter on the side it was good as well. Nicki explained the signature sauce and she thoroughly explained the specials for the day. PjMweiE3sfEmmHmUU_KGdg.text: I always past by this place and finally decided to try it out. I can see why it has so many reviews. I love the decorations of the restaurant. "Where the locals eat" was a nice staple wall art and I also liked their "menu of the day" specials. It gives that authentic old school diner feel but also feels modern. I will start by saying the service was amazing. I haven't had that good of service in a long time. He really made sure we were taken care of and got whatever we needed quickly. We were one of the first people for dinner but he was still attentive when it started getting busy.  I got the Chicken Alfredo, it came with bacon and tomatoes. The pasta and extra things reminded me of pasta carbonara, if they added mushrooms I woulda been sold on that. Either way it was still delicious. My boyfriend got a breakfast combo called the Bissell Breakfast. He really enjoyed it. I give this place 4 and a half stars. I would give a 5 but my only complaint would be some of the menu items are overpriced. I've had the same style food for lower prices but I guess because this place is so popular the price doesn't make that big of a difference they can charge the price. I would definitely come back to try other menu items.

yDLJ39kLPrNgqjRH1OFIPA.text: We adore this restaurant. Most of the servers are fantastic!  Ask for Kiara or Jen! NtkQ_0KTMxfjHPIQIB8tjg.text: Today's my daughter's birthday so we were out of town. So decided to look up a breakfast place and forgo the hotel free breakfast. Best decision ever ! I looked at the menu and said let go here . We were greeted and seated promptly.  ServiceI have to put this disclaimer in immediately. My family can be very difficult to handle with all the special requests that come in waves. For some reason we can't give them at once. It actually annoys me every time. However, our waiter Kieran (Spelled wrong ) did not even blink an eye. He handled our requests like he knew our playbook. I suggest you ask for him. Very pleasant and inviting . Not a long wait for the food.   Food- I order the biscuits with gray and eggs. This was OUTSTANDING second to none.  Not to heavy , delicious, homemade biscuits worth the trip just for this meal.  My son had the cinnamon roll pancakes and his words verbatim- Best pancakes I ever had. I was a little offend since I felt like I was the pancake king. However, after a bite I couldn't argue . We had a side of home fries and this was don't judge a book by its cover. Presentation was rather plain but taste was not plain at all . Nothing left on the plate.  Daughter had the chicken and biscuit and also loved it. She usually offers a bite but never offered anyone. She just kept saying so so good.  Overall, a picky family was extremely extremely satisfied.  Would love to come back soon if ever in the area again. Love this place .   FYI - Owner works just as hard as the staff. Enough said!!

_Q5KxPuCU_LUCaYBlHRAhA.text: I freakin love this place. Everything and I mean EVERYTHING is delicious. Not only that, the portions are huge and they are very reasonably priced. Another great thing is they run a very tight ship and the food always comes out FAST.   We're serial brunchers and I love a unique avacado toast and Benedict as much as the next guy but sometimes you just want a good old fashioned simple down home breakfast.   Today I was craving chicken and waffles. Forget those waffles sold with wings or chicken tenders, you get a half chicken (breast, wing, leg & thigh)! Now that's a whole lotta chicken so thankfully they allow you to do a quarter chicken and I always get white meat only (breast & wing).   The waffles have powdered sugar an amazing strawberry butter. So yum! For the fried chicken they created sweet and spicy dipping sauce is a mix of Louisiana hot sauce and maple syrup. So good. They also have some bangin mimosas. Always a good choice.

8soObm7eJ4tgAFlP1PGOWA.text: We recently came here for Father's Day and the place was very busy. Despite that almost every table was taken, we were promptly seated and our server gave us a few moments to settle.  We were given great service and told of the specials (some very unique for breakfast/brunch). Food was quickly delivered and made exactly as ordered. Our server made a few rounds to check in on us and make sure we were set.  The owner of the restaurant also made it around to every table to wish them a happy Father's Day as well, and gave everyone a coupon for their next visit.  We found the food to be very good, great service, and good location as well. No complaints, this is a nice place to have a great meal. This is a definite repeat for us!

fjZp430L0TmloXof9q-P7g.text: Bold city and holy davoli burgers were great. Breakfast was good too. Expect a wait. The only thing upon entering we didn't enjoy was the smell of burnt pancakes or waffles

XldaE8TJw3hXB01xQUXqRw.text: ErmaGERD, O.M.to the flippin do this place has become a favorite if not my #1 recommendation for breakfast hands down. Make sure you don't miss the the specials board or ask what the specials are Hands down, my favorite breakfast spot in all of Charlotte. It kills me that some people would wait up to and over an hour for bacon and eggs when you could go anywhere else or make it at home... Proof in the pudding the breakfast innovations like strawberry butter and stuffed waffles you really can't get anywhere else. The price point is more than fair when comparing to the sub par competition. I absolutely love it here and as busy as they are the service each visit has taken pride in their work, prompt fast, friendly and suggestive. I wish every restaurant could hire the management team here to train their service on the basics that's what I think of this place. For their volume of business and being able to push out quality food, the kitchen staff - I salute you. I have a passion for cooking and can definitely see the head chef does as well and it shows in the precision and speed

a9GySvkgKluzNEVzSqDiHg.text: So good; delicious and something for everyone. We were hot and tired after leaving the mall. Thought about going somewhere a little high end in Southpark but bf said he was starving. I knew there would be a huge wait so we just decided to stop here, as we'd had breakfast in the past. So glad we did - fast service, great menu: pot roast, shrimp and grits, chicken fried steak, chicken and waffles, chicken parm, fish platter, meatloaf, breakfast for dinner, burgers, sandwiches, salads... and everything is VERY good. I had extremely tender pork roast and veg. It was like eating at moms except you don't have to help clean up.

KFd5Fk8cVW6nw_E0lCr0Zw.text: I was really underwhelmed by my experience here. The service was awesome and our waitress was very attentive, but the food & coffee was sadly lacking. So 4-star service, but def 2-star on the food!  The coffee was very bland and the egg, bacon, cheese croissant I got was big, but also bland (I added some hot sauce, which helped) w/the croissant being way too mushy. I got the cheese grits on the side because they came highly recommended by the waitress, but they were way too watery and the cheese was very clumpy. I LOVE grits, but these were just not good and lacked the texture that grits should have.  All in all, I don't know that I would be back. The place was packed, so obviously people love this place, I just didn't have an experience here foodwise (especially for the price) to come back.

Atza_Hu5WrK-FjZrr691PA.text: (7/25/19) I had an early night, tonight so we headed over to Metro Diner. My wife is having a Reuben sandwich and I've ordered some loaded chips to start and some shrimp and grits for my main course. Dinner was pretty quiet, but very filling.

6P-DgxE2MI-WDqRHq4noXA.text: Solid food, extensive menu, cozy diner feel.  I came for brunch and decided on the metro pancake: the 12 inch challenge. It's kind of a joke for them to call this a challenge. It looks large, but I demolished it easily. I will say it was a perfectly executed, classic American pancake. Soft, fluffy, and nicely browned. I only wish they served it with real maple syrup. Not an unreasonable request given the price point, I don't think.

Ah1KkjljHKFX94pxeK6AvA.text: This food is so good!!! Their always packed and service is exceptional I ordered the veggie omelette it was so filling and delicious

30pBItqa5xBeqZZnTt-yDg.text: Chicken and Waffles are a must!!! This Metro Diner is always consistent. There is normally a wait for a table and the food is always good.   I've had several items off the menu but I definitely recommend you have the Chicken and Waffles at least once. My favorite part is the hot sauce syrup they make for you at the table.   My mom loves their grits and I give them major props for that because grits ain't easy and especially making them for the masses.   I really love the self serve drink station they have up front for the waiting area. This a great way to keep customers happy while waiting for a table.   The menu at Metro is very extensive and I'm excited to try some of the other items they have available like the cinnamon roll pancake.
